oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Garth Brooks Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Garth Brooks (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Garth Brooks; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Garth talks about "Not Counting You" being a 'tongue in cheek' type song and the expediency of how he wrote it why selling boots -- (01:03) Brooks talks about going up in Oklahoma, performing with Santa Fe and eventually moving to Nashville to sign a publishing deal / recording -- (02:01) Biff Collie and Brooks talk about "I've Got a Good Thing Going" and how its about someone losing their love -- (02:52) Brooks and Collie talk about having to experience a song before being able to sing believably -- (03:52) Collie and Brooks joke about his album title Garth Brooks and its originality -- (04:27) "If Tomorrow Never Comes" by Brooks is compared to "Tomorrow Never Comes" by Collie and Brooks describes it as a question to whether or not someone loved their wife as much as the could -- (06:10) Brooks tell "Everytime That It Rains" was written for a women, before he knew his wife, as a memory -- (07:04) Brooks talks about "Alabama Clay" drawing effect to Brooks about a boy who never knew he had a kid -- (08:26) "Much Too Young (To Feel This Damn Old)" by Brooks is reflected on its popularity -- (09:43) Brooks tells about how his song [possibly Cowboy Bill] floors his every time after -- (10:44) Brooks talks about "Nobody Gets Off in This Town" and figuring out the jabs it took to the places he was playing -- (11:56) Brooks says his wish for every artist is to work with Allen Reynolds -- (12:41) "I Know One" is talked about with Brooks meeting John Peel and being terrified to perform "I Know One" -- (14:06) Collie recaps the "I Know One" components and Brooks reflects on its importance -- (14:44) Brooks talks about "The Dance" and his immediate want to work with Tony Arata -- (16:41) Brooks thanks Collie and Collie returns the remarks -- (17:12) Collie tells why he remembers Brooks birthday and the outro is cut off
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Brooks, Garth; Collie, Biff;
